comments:
In the first implementation of generics in the JDI client, the method returning
the name of types were returning the name with extra generic information,
jdt.debug.ui had no work to do to display these information.
But that was wrong, the JDI client was modified to return only the 'simple' name
of types.
jdt.debug.ui need to be updated to computed and display the generic information.

I released a first set of changes. I added the method getGenericSignature() to
IJavaValue and IJavaVariable and updated their implementations.

IJavaValue, IJavaVariable: added new API method getGenericSignature()
IJDIValue, InterpreterVariable, JDIPlaceholderVariable, JDIArrayEntryVariable,
JDIFieldVariable, JDILocalVariable, JDIThisVariable, JDIFieldVariable:
implemented the new method.
We should display generic information in the variables.

Done.
I modified the implementation of the Java debug model, so the get*Name() methods
return the generic name, if available.

MethodImpl - reverted argumentTypeNames().
JDIModelPresentation - fixed removeQualifierFromGenericName() to correctly
handle array types.
JDIReferenceType - added getGenericName(ReferenceType).
JDIArrayEntryVariable, JDIFieldVariable, JDILocalVariable, JDIObjectValue,
JDIStackFrame, JDIValue - modified the get*Name() methods.
